data.title: Not a bad seat in the house.
data.text:
I recently went with some friend to see Vickie Lawrence at the Arlington Music Hall.  We sat in the balcony. The seats were fine, the acoustics good, and there was a bar downstairs for intermission refreshments. 
It was not a fancy place but it was clean, up to date, professionally run and good value for the price.

data.title: Never going there again.
data.text: We took our 85 year old mother to see Vicki Lawrence.  A raunchy and vulgar show.  Not what your would expect from "Mama" on TV.  Requested a refund because the Music Hall did not advertise "Adult Content".  We also had 2 drunk guys sitting on the row in front of us.  The GM said all sales final and refused to refund 3 tickets.  You would think you could afford 3 tickets before taking the change of losing patrons.

data.title: Beatles vs Stones
data.text: Beatles vs Stones show was awesome!!!  The guy doing Mick Jagger was unbelievable and made the whole show!  Fun to imagine two such hot bands back in the day going head to head!  The place was packed - we were a bit toward the back under the ceiling of the balcony with a speaker just above our head.  I think the sound would have been better to be closer.  Love the show and will be looking for other shows we would like to see.  Lots of great restaurants nearby.

data.title: Nice, old-fashioned, comfortable theater
data.text:
Went here to see a Beetles/Rolling Stones show here. It is a narrow hall so every seat was reasonably centered.  The seats were comfortable with good leg room. The sound quality was good. There was a large lobby area for intermission. 

Nothing fancy, but more than adequate, with lots of good restaurants near by. I would go here again.

data.title: I enjoy concerts here
data.text: My husband and I saw Larry Gatlin and the Gatlin brothers here last weekend. They put in a great show and the venue was wonderful. I love the feel of the old theater with nice updates. The restrooms Andy concession area are clean and easily maneuvered. The venue is small enough that your concert experience feels more intimate. The area outside the theater is great too: Babe's and the Grease Monkey Burgers are within walking distance to make parking much easier. Well done!

data.title: The Oak Ridge Boys
data.text:
This was my eighth event at AMH. The seating is good and the venue is lovely. I have never had s bad experience here. 
I enjoy it because it is a smaller venue. They have valet parking which is not the most professional, especially upon leaving. However, the venue itself is without fault in my eyes.

data.title: Wonderful entertainment
data.text: The Arlington Music Hall always offers a great show, whether it is local country music or famous entertainers from our past.  They specialize in country shows and the local singers always offer all you need to fulfill your country music fix.  As for famous live shows, we have seen such greats as Mickey Gilley, Brenda Lee, Larry Gatlin, and so many others we grew up with.  The famous name shows are generally offered monthly.  The local country shows are every other Saturday.  Pricing is almost always very reasonable.  Some old time stars may cost more but we usually pay $20.00 to $35.00 per seat.

data.title: Not quiet what it could be,if your in the younger crowd
data.text: I would say this is for a  much older crowd. I can say that it's pleasant,but i think they could take notes from the rock box theater. They need a little faster pace and more updated venue. But it is affordable. Not all the shows are slow, but a good deal of them are.They have sometimes to much of there own family entertaining you.

data.title: Great Venue!
data.text: This venue has provided great Country and Western Entertainment for years but it also serves a host to many other artist. It's and old Movie theater that has about 1.200 seats, for those of us who grew up in the time when this was a movie theater its a little nostalgic!

data.title: Definitely an Arlington-thing-to-do!
data.text: Experiences at the Music Hall are a bit folksy, but all of the seats are good, the staff is pleasant and the entertainment is worth the price of the ticket.

data.title: The Historic Arlington Music Hall
data.text: The Arlington Music Hall presents great shows at an affordable cost.  We attended Burk Collin's Country Gospel show for only $20.00.  A bargain for such great local talent presenting great music and entertainment.    Burk Collins also produces traditional country shows at the same quality level.  The $20.00 shows are presented at least once a month and are a no-miss night of old fashioned, clean entertainment.

data.title: Great venue!
data.text: What a great venue small enough that you feel connected to the artist.  The venue is comfortable, and feels casual.  They make you feel at home and at peace.

data.title: Small Concert Venue
data.text: Arlington Music Hall is a nice intimate place to enjoy a concert.  It is a remodeled older movie theater located near Arlington City Hall.  We saw Don Williams and the sound and closeness to the stage was amazing.  There is plenty of free parking in the area and they sometimes have valet parking.  There are several nice places to grab a bite before the show such as Babes and Mellow Mushroom within walking distance.  There is beer; wine and margaritas for sale in the concession area and you van bring them into the seating area.  It is generally an older crowd and is a lot tamer than a lot of concert venues.

data.title: "Little Texas" in Arlington Tx
data.text: My first time to go to the Arlington Music Hall. Got to see "Little Texas"  (a country band).  Loved the remodeled walk-in movie theatre into a concert venue.  A perfect place to go for an intimate concert experience.

data.title: Stompin music
data.text: Love coming here to their concerts and things...Used to come almost every Sat night until they closed down and only have special events now.

data.title: Talent not as good anymore.
data.text: This place has really gone downhill as far as show production sine it was Johnny Highs Music Review.  What a shame.

data.title: Wish they had more artists
data.text: I have only been once, but love love love this venue. More intimate setting than AA Center which is also great. Lots of pride in keeping this a gem. Concessions are cheap which was a pleasant surprise and you could take them into the theater. I was very impressed with it.  I only wish there were more performers scheduled.

data.title: Symphony Arlington
data.text: My husband and I have attended most of the symphony performances at the Music Hall. Last season the emphasis was on Spanish music, the year before Shakespere.  Even our grandkids have attended and loved it!

data.title: Sara Evans Show
data.text: Sara was awesome. It was a very intimate setting. Seating was comfortable. Great venue. Can't wait to go back.

data.title: Arlington Live! Great Experience!
data.text: We went to this with our cousins to a regular country music review and the talent was fantastic! The show was polished and professional. My only question is where are the locals with this gem in their midst?  We live in Texas North and would kill to have something like this to go to on the odd Saturday night. Thanks for the great show guys, and our MC.......you my man are one of a kind!
